subject: VAM pro EMI issues
description_text:
Hi,

I have installed the VAM pro onto my Plus X brake pedal and I'm
noticing significant interference in the brake input when the motor
activates. I have attached the grounding cable and tried with all other usb
devices disconnected as well and this still has not fixed the issue. The
only way to fix it is to increase the strength of the effect over ~60%.
However, I want to run the ABS effect at ~25% strength and 25Hz and this
causes huge interference in the brake input that makes the game undrivable
with the motor.

Do you have any suggestions to fix this?

Regards,
Navin

conversations.body_text: Hi，Navin Adikari，   ​Could you please install the Todesk tool? It doesn’t require registration—just provide the ID and temporary password after installation, and I can assist you remotely in disabling the FIR filter. We’ll also release a new version soon, allowing customers to choose whether to enable or disable the filter for smoother input curves.

I believe I found the option to remove the filter. Is it the option in the
image I've sent? What should I set it at to remove the filter completely?

On Sat, 14 Jun 2025 at 12:03, service@simsonn.com

Hi，Navin Adikari，  ​ Yes, that’s the correct setting. You just need to set all three axis values to 0 to disable the function. However, you’ll also need to quickly double-click the version number (2.0.7 or 2.0.8) in the settings interface — this will bring up a hidden dialog. In that popup, select the .cfg configuration file you previously saved in the software and re-import it. Then click “Save.” This should disable the function. Alternatively, you can try saving a new configuration file and reloading it to confirm the setting was applied successfully.

Hi，Navin Adikari，     ​Has your issue been resolved? If not, I can provide you with a test version of the software that includes the necessary adjustments. We’ve already added a toggle option for this in the updated version.

Hi yes the issue is fully resolved now, thanks for the help!

I have one more question. I had the plus X pedals and the VAM pro haptic
reactor in my order. I have only received the pedals so far, do you have
any idea when the haptic reactor will ship? The order number is SSN1572

Thanks

On Mon, 16 Jun 2025 at 16:46, service@simsonn.com

Sorry one more thing. When I try to change the maximum force value under
the brake it always resets to whatever I calibrated it to. Right now if I
want to recalibrate the brake I need to recalibrate and set deadzones for
all 3 pedals. I would like to be able to either calibrate each pedal
individually or be able to adjust the maximum force value without it
resetting. Alternatively, allow us to make the deadzone less than 85 so its
possible to quickly change the force needed to reach maximum braking

      主题: Plux X pedals input latency  
      描述:  
 Hi, 
   
 I've just received the plus x pedals and I am noticing significant input latency on all 3 pedals. When I fully press the pedal there is a noticeable delay before it reaches 100% and when I release it also smoothly goes back to 0%. When I compare this to my previous pedals or a handbrake I have, the signal goes very quickly from 0 to 100. It almost seems like there is some smoothing added to the signal which makes it not respond quickly. Is there any way to fix this? 
   
 Thanks, 
 
 Navin

Hi Navin Adikari,  We’ve tested all frequency and force settings and confirmed that they do not interfere with the brake signal. Please provide a video showing the issue, and then I can assist you remotely via Todesk to help identify the problem.

Hi

Here is a video showing the issue: https://streamable.com/la90h7
You can see the signal jump when I press the 'vibration' button in the
software to activate the motor. It's worse with certain settings and better
with others.

Regards,
Navin

On Mon, 7 Jul 2025 at 13:30, service@simsonn.com

Hi Navin Adikari,    May I ask what maximum force you used when calibrating the brake pedal? It’s possible that the calibration was too light, which could cause signal issues.  I recommend installing the Todesk software. No registration is needed—just install it and send me your ID and temporary password, and I can assist you remotely right now.     https://dl.todesk.com/windows/ToDesk_Setup.exe

Hi

I am using 40kg maximum brake force. I have tried connecting the pedals to
my old control box from another pedal set and running the haptic motor on
the simsonn control box and this reduces the interference a lot. It is
still there but not as bad. Would I need to isolate something inside the
control box to fix this issue? I'm not available right now for remote
support but I don't think it's anything that can be fixed on my computer,
it seems like a hardware issue.

Navin

On Mon, 7 Jul 2025 at 22:25, service@simsonn.com

Hi Navin Adikari,     You may refer to this EMI solution, which was shared by another VAM Pro user and successfully resolved his issue. Also, please check whether you've connected the top-left screw of the control box to the pedal using a grounding wire. This creates a complete EMI path from the controller to the pedal and from the rig to the PC, which helps improve system stability.     https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting     https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

Hi

Yes I have connected the ground wire to the top left screw. I tried
connecting a wire straight from my pedals to the ground pin on a power
socket and this still has not resolved the issue. I noticed that the
interference is less with the ground cable than when it's disconnected but
its still quite bad. Any suggestions? Maybe the ground wire is too thin?


On Tue, 8 Jul 2025 at 13:20, service@simsonn.com
Hi Navin Adikari,    Please try testing with the MOZA base turned off to see if there’s still any interference.
